meanings.definition: To make or become hard or harder.
meanings.sent1: The sun can harden clay into pottery.
meanings.sent2: She used a hammer to harden the metal.
meanings.sent3: The cold weather seemed to harden the ground overnight.
meanings.sent4: His resolve to succeed only seemed to harden with each setback.
meanings.sent5: The exercise routine was designed to gradually harden the muscles.

meanings.sent1: Training in the gym can help harden your body.
meanings.sent2: Eating healthy foods can help harden your immune system.
meanings.sent3: The coach's strict regimen was meant to harden the team for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent4: The challenges they faced together only served to harden their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The experience of living alone in the wilderness can harden a person's survival skills.

meanings.definition: To become fixed, settled, or unyielding.
meanings.sent1: Over time, his opinions began to harden and were difficult to change.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations seemed to harden as both parties refused to compromise.
meanings.sent3: Her heart started to harden after being hurt too many times.
meanings.sent4: The ice cream had started to harden in the freezer.
meanings.sent5: The old tree's bark had hardened over the years, becoming rough and sturdy.
